attributes.action: allow the United Kingdom to carry out a trial period for (SDST) Standard Double Summer Time
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To carry out a trial period whereby winter is GMT +1, equivalent to British Summer Time, and summer is GMT +2. 

A similar trial to the one carried out in 1968/71

I would suggest a good time for this would be from 2010 to 2013, which would take in to account the 2012 Olympics.
Allot less energy would be consumed here.

The UK is a signatory to the Kyoto agreement, and is committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, a move to SDST would help to achieve the target for reducing carbon emissions.

A boost in tourism revenue would be a grate benefit too with the longer daylight hours, and also a dramatic decrease in Road accidents.

If this didnt work for Scotland, being so far north, they could stick to the same time zone but could work around it.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
